caption.p: Summarization of recent herbal plant treatments by using ultrasound in different application fields.

tr.td: Ultrasound treated samples yield rate increased almost two times compared to the heat-reflux method. Also, it has greater efficiency for the saponins yield and bioaccessibility.

The results showed that ultrasound treatment had a considerable impact on the protein structure and it could increase the protein susceptibility digestive enzymes like pepsin and trypsin. In which, us is providing a powerful endorsement for increasing the protein proteolysis.
Ultrasonic horn and probe sonotrode system
Thermosonication, extraction and application in nanofiber technology

Thermosonication showed the most important influence on the extraction yield. Also, for tarragon, the antioxidant activity is increased at 250 W however it decreased with increasing the power until 500 W because of the destructive effect of ultrasonic treatment at high intensity.
Compared with traditional extraction method, ultrasound has enhanced the four saponins yields. With potential advantages involving shorter extraction time, it decreased the consumed solvent.

For glycyrrhizauralensis as thermal stable polysaccharide, the optimal extraction parameters of glycyrrhiza polysaccharide is 600 W for 60 min at 70 °C. And for turpiniae folium is 200 W for 30 min at 30 °C
Sonication for nanocubes and nanosphere nanocomposite

In this work, ultrasound synthesized an efficient photocatalyst nano-cubes and nanospheres by using C. limon LE and Ag:CdO. In which, C. limon phytocomponents played an effective role as reducing and stabilizing agent.
Cylindrical jacket with in-built piezoelectric US transducer rode

US assisted green synthesis of iron oxide nanoparticles using coriander extract as a reducing agent. In which, it showed higher antioxidant and antimicrobial activity compared to the conventional method due to the combined effect of US and the plant molecules attached with iron oxide nanoparticles.
Catechin and gallic acid extracted yields were increased by 3.7 and 2.1 times with increasing US power from 44 to 125 W. However, the yields were not significantly increased over 125w power and 35°C.

Ultrasound showed the highest level of desirable phenolic compounds. In which, exhibit the highest level of antimicrobial and antiviral activities especially against hepatitis a and murine norovirus. Also, it increased the decontamination of lettuce herb.
Ultrasound increased C═C bond and c/o ratio, which is beneficial to improve the electrochemical function of materials
Piezoelectric ceramic ultrasound bath, horn, probe sonotrode
Sono-solid-phase microextraction , hydrolysis, and physicochemical and functional properties studies

Ultrasound increased the polyphenols, flavonoids, and volatiles concentrations of medium-to-low volatility fractions which may function as an assisted tool to volatiles extract from tea herb. Also, hydrolysis efficiency for tea reducing sugars production is increased by US.
Ultrasound can be used for fabricating of inexpensive, simple, eco-friendly hibiscus with ZnO and other nanostructures to extend their utility in different areas of nanotechnology.
US pretreatment enhances mulberry drying kinetics and reduces total energy consumption without affecting product quality.
US pretreatment significantly reduced the drying time and consumed energy up to 29.8% and 33.6%. Also, it increased parsley chlorophyll a and b resistance to the drying process.
Drying chamber with piezoelectric US transducer (1500 W)
US improved the convective drying of peppermint. In which, The results showed that it decreased energy consumption and increased energy efficiency up to 3.69%.
Increased efficiency and decreased processing time
Ultrasonic assistant extraction shortened the processing time and provided lower solvent consumption

Enhanced product quality and shorted time and decreased processing cost of thyme herb. Also, US increased total polyphenols and flavonoids yields and extraction efficiency from Serpylliherba or wild thyme.
